alert.note: Alert for Howard (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 16 at 11:57AM CST by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR AN ICE JAM REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM CST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam continues. * WHERE...A portion of central Nebraska, including the following county, Howard. * WHEN...Until 300 PM CST Friday. * IMPACTS...River flows are elevated due to ice jamming along the North Loup River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1144 AM CST, emergency management reported the buildup of ice near the Highway 281 bridge remains in place. This may lead to minor flooding of surrounding areas, including the Lake of the Woods area north of St. Paul. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Central Howard County - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
